title: Rare Portsea mansion hits the market for $22m
text:
The founders of a furniture manufacturer which fits out offices for some of the largest companies in Australia and Asia have listed their Portsea mansion for sale with price expectations of between $20 million to $22 million.

John Fisher, who co-founded Zenith Interiors in 1990, and his wife Jenny are selling their Hamptons-inspired residence on the Portsea clifftop in Victoria after buying an older home on the land 12 years ago for just $2.3 million and rebuilding.

This property has hit the market with expectations of $20m to $22m.

The 'Moonya' property is a six-bedroom home with a cinema room, swimming pool and gym.

The Fishers more recently acquired the adjoining block behind the house and added a tennis court and pavillion. It is the first time in more than 100 years the two parcels of land – 3684 and 3686 Point Nepean Road – totalling 2,800 sq m are being sold together.

Selling agent Rob Curtain, of Peninsula Sothebys International Realty, said there had never been anything this new brought to market on the Portsea clifftops.
description: The founders of a furniture manufacturer which fits out offices for some of the largest companies in Australia and Asia have listed their Portsea mansion for sale with price expectations of between $20 to $22 million.
